intro: Bupleurum spinosum var. mauritanicum, commonly known as the spiny bupleurum, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region and North Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes caraway and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in dry, coastal areas. It is known for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits. Its distinctive spiny stems and fragrant foliage make it a unique addition to botanical gardens.
